facts: An octave is the distance between two notes where the higher note vibrates at exactly twice the frequency of the lower note.
A major scale follows the step pattern whole, whole, half, whole, whole, whole, half.
A minor scale often sounds sadder than a major scale because its third note is lower by one half step.
A chord is made when three or more notes are played together, and a basic triad uses the 1st, 3rd, and 5th notes of a scale.
Rhythm is organized using a time signature, like 4/4, which means four beats fit in each measure and the quarter note gets one beat.
Sharps raise a note by one half step and flats lower a note by one half step.
A key signature tells you which notes are sharp or flat throughout a song, helping musicians avoid writing the same symbols over and over.
